intro: Navarretia prolifera subsp. prolifera, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or coastal habitats. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Navarretia prolifera subsp. prolifera is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments.
